summary: The diff largely implements the requested onboarding stabilization: onboarding submission is gated on a stable readiness signal, Enter-key submission is prevented while disabled, and error normalization replaces the literal "Actor not available" with a friendly message. However, the diff also introduces additional, broader App initialization/error UI changes and extra error-normalization mappings that were not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Broader App-level init loading/error UI with retry and normalized error display (not specific to onboarding/actor readiness)
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on stabilizing the Onboard Client flow and onboarding error messaging; the diff adds new global init loading/error screens and retry behavior in App.tsx beyond those requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Additional error-normalization mappings for various backend trap/messages unrelated to "Actor not available"
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 only asks to replace user-facing occurrences of the literal "Actor not available" with a friendly message; the diff also normalizes multiple other specific backend messages.
